title: yolov3 quantization
body:
I try to quantize yolov3.
So I add a first layer in the file yolov3.yaml : [-1, 1, torch.quantization.QuantStub,[]]
and an other layer in the class Detect : torch.quantization.DeQuantStub()

```
class Detect(nn.Module):
    stride = None  # strides computed during build
    export = False  # onnx export

    def __init__(self, nc=80, anchors=(), ch=()):  # detection layer
        super(Detect, self).__init__()
        self.nc = nc  # number of classes
        self.no = nc + 5  # number of outputs per anchor
        self.nl = len(anchors)  # number of detection layers
        self.na = len(anchors[0]) // 2  # number of anchors
        self.grid = [torch.zeros(1)] * self.nl  # init grid
        a = torch.tensor(anchors).float().view(self.nl, -1, 2)
        self.register_buffer('anchors', a)  # shape(nl,na,2)
        self.register_buffer('anchor_grid', a.clone().view(self.nl, 1, -1, 1, 1, 2))  # shape(nl,1,na,1,1,2)
        self.m = nn.ModuleList(nn.Conv2d(x, self.no * self.na, 1) for x in ch)  # output conv

        self.dequant = torch.quantization.DeQuantStub()  # layer add for quantization


    def forward(self, x):
        # x = x.copy()  # for profiling
        z = []  # inference output
        self.training |= self.export
        for i in range(self.nl):
            x[i] = self.m[i](x[i])  # conv
            bs, _, ny, nx = x[i].shape  # x(bs,255,20,20) to x(bs,3,20,20,85)
            x[i] = x[i].view(bs, self.na, self.no, ny, nx).permute(0, 1, 3, 4, 2).contiguous()

            x[i] = self.dequant(x[i])   #  add for quantization

            if not self.training:  # inference
                if self.grid[i].shape[2:4] != x[i].shape[2:4]:
                    self.grid[i] = self._make_grid(nx, ny).to(x[i].device)

                y = x[i].sigmoid()
                y[..., 0:2] = (y[..., 0:2] * 2. - 0.5 + self.grid[i].to(x[i].device)) * self.stride[i]  # xy
                y[..., 2:4] = (y[..., 2:4] * 2) ** 2 * self.anchor_grid[i]  # wh
                z.append(y.view(bs, -1, self.no))

        return x if self.training else (torch.cat(z, 1), x)

```
The size of m model is divided by 4 (246.48 MB to 62.63 MB) but there is no improvement in my inference time.

Any idea ?
